column4: I think I found my problem, looks like there isn't just a universal repo for all versions of Ubuntu, I am currently using Hardy Heron, and it isn't updating SDL to the extent that is needed by the source I am trying to compile, does anyone know if (If possible) I could update my repos so they use a newer version of Ubuntu's repos?
I would upgrade, but I really don't feel like partitioning, or restarting from scratch on this system...
Any ideas anyone? :\

what are you trying to build? and you can always do a dist-upgrade, but I've successfully added newer repositories, installed newer packages (from jaunty into my intrepid install) then disabled the newer repos
also it seems terribly risky, so i'm not saying "do it" but just that it worked for me ;-)
hah, i was building that a while ago
even when it did build for me it got stuck in an infinite loop soon after starting
er, that was after i fixed one error in the source code to make it not segfault :-/ lol
Sounds like you had fun. :o
how do you know you need a newer version of SDL? it's been pretty stagnant, SDL 2.0 got permanently put on hold
http://pastebin.com/d2125aac7

that's confusing to me, first it says it doesn't have SDL_mixer.h then it says it's too old... forgive me for asking but you *do* have libsdl1.2-mixer-dev installed right? (package name not quite accurate)
Yes I do.
I installed them just recently... I guess that's not the problem huh?

hrm, i wonder how they've decided SDL_mixer is too old... anyways if you're feeling brave you can change your repositories to point to intrepid and update your SDL dev files, and then change your repositories back
How do you do that? I've played around with the repos a bit before, and I had to fix them the first time around. :o
basically replace every 'hardy' in /etc/apt/sources.list with 'intrepid' but again it's a bit risky i guess (i dunno, worked for me, but i don't want to say "it'll definitely work")
Thanks, I'll try that... I'll first back up stuff though. :p
definitely! good luck...
also any reason why you don't just upgrade to intrepid altogether?
it'd probably be less risky
It worked! Now I have fully functiional intrepid repos... \o/
nice! good luck
I now have 728 updates. :p
